document.discussion_title: GreenvilleOnline.com | Greenville News | The Greenville News
document.topic_text: Mohammad Moghimi told The Associated Press Monday that an appeals court reduced Atena Farghadani's 12-year prison sentence to 18 months and "she will be freed soon. In June 2014, a court sentenced Farghadani, a cartoonist, over a cartoon that criticized a law limiting women' On Sunday, Iran freed Nazak Afshar, an Iranian-French former employee of the France embassy in Tehran, after nearly two months in jail over her alleged role in 2009 post-election protests. The moves are seen as efforts to soften Iran's image and improve relations with the West following the 2015 landmark nuclear agreement.
document.post: Mohammad Moghimi told The Associated Press Monday that an appeals court reduced Atena Farghadani's 12-year prison sentence to 18 months and "she will be freed soon. In June 2014, a court sentenced Farghadani, a cartoonist, over a cartoon that criticized a law limiting women' On Sunday, Iran freed Nazak Afshar, an Iranian-French former employee of the France embassy in Tehran, after nearly two months in jail over her alleged role in 2009 post-election protests. The moves are seen as efforts to soften Iran's image and improve relations with the West following the 2015 landmark nuclear agreement.
